summary: Endgame Fix-It Fic Note: This is literally 540 words (and 20 mins worth of writing) of Tony and Steve (and some Peggy) feels, so...
body:
Endgame Fix-It Fic

Note: This is literally 540 words (and 20 mins worth of writing) of Tony and Steve (and some Peggy) feels, so see it as Stony, or don’t. It’s up to you. This is shit. Enjoy.

tagging some people who might like this idk: @holygreund (thank u for the rec) @anxieteandbiscuits (for making me emotional with ur stuff)

He sat, lip pulled down and eyebrows creased together, staring deeply into the monitor. It felt like his heart was aching, constant and burning in his chest, under his ribcage. He wasn’t sure if it was guilt or shame. Perhaps both.

“Cap?” a croaked voice whispered in the darkness. Steve could see Tony’s face illuminated blue from the nightlight set in the corner of the room. He was gaunt, cheekbones too pronounced and eyes too hollow – it reminded Steve of what Tony was like after the Chitauri invaded. He didn’t know what to do back then, but he thought he knew what to do now.

“Hey, Tony,” Steve replied, just as quietly. He thought his ears would ring if he spoke any louder. “How are you feeling?”

“Tired,” the man replied, turning his head so his cheek rested comfortably into the pillow, dark eyes staring back at Steve. “Weird.” He weakly nodded his head to the stump of his arm. “I thought having no heart was strange, but this…” he released a soft breath, “it doesn’t feel real.”

“It’s better than your life,” Steve remarked softly.

“Yeah. I’ve always had a thing for trying to get myself killed, huh,” Tony said, a huff of a laugh following his words.

Steve couldn’t help the crooked, closed-lipped smile cross his face. “Not this time, Shellhead.”

“No,” Tony agreed, his eyes heavy. “Not this time.”

They lapsed back into silence. Steve watched as Tony’s eyelids fluttered shut, sleep taking over him. He swallowed, blinked, and realized his eyes were wet. He reached a hand out and rested it next to Tony’s limp one, where a heartbeat monitor was clipped on his thumb. He glanced back up at Tony’s face; noted his parted lips and lax expression. He looked back at his hand. Maybe…?

“You did the right thing.” It was so weak that Steve scarcely heard it, but it was enough to make Steve’s eyes snap back to Tony’s face in a startle. His eyes were still shut, and there was still a softness to his lips. “It was hard, but you did.”

Steve’s fingers grasped the sheets of the bed. “I know.” And he hated that he did.

“Peggy would’ve wanted you to live your life here. With us. You know that,” Tony spoke. Steve couldn’t bring himself to meet his gaze – he wasn’t sure if Tony’s eyes were even open. “She told you to move on. She’d want you to move on, not be stuck in the past. You deserve a family like she did.”

Steve’s eyes burned with tears, but he refused to let them fall.

He jumped when dainty fingers weakly grasped his own, curling around the digits. Only the last three fingers, hardly a full touch, yet Steve’s shoulders shook at the contact.

“We need you,” Tony murmured, more breath than words. “I’m glad you’re here, Winghead.”

“I’m glad you’re here, too, Tony.” Steve couldn’t let himself say anymore. His voice was too shaky. He felt a tear slip down his cheek, but didn’t move to wipe it away.

“Go see if Nat’s okay, too,” were Tony’s last words before he fell asleep.

Steve smiled, blue eyes glassy.

They won.

Endgame Fix-It Fic

Note: This is literally 540 words (and 20 mins worth of writing) of Tony and Steve (and some Peggy) feels, so see it as Stony, or don’t. It’s up to you. This is shit. Enjoy.

tagging some people who might like this idk: @holygreund (thank u for the rec) @anxieteandbiscuits (for making me emotional with ur stuff)

He sat, lip pulled down and eyebrows creased together, staring deeply into the monitor. It felt like his heart was aching, constant and burning in his chest, under his ribcage. He wasn’t sure if it was guilt or shame. Perhaps both.

“Cap?” a croaked voice whispered in the darkness. Steve could see Tony’s face illuminated blue from the nightlight set in the corner of the room. He was gaunt, cheekbones too pronounced and eyes too hollow – it reminded Steve of what Tony was like after the Chitauri invaded. He didn’t know what to do back then, but he thought he knew what to do now.

“Hey, Tony,” Steve replied, just as quietly. He thought his ears would ring if he spoke any louder. “How are you feeling?”

“Tired,” the man replied, turning his head so his cheek rested comfortably into the pillow, dark eyes staring back at Steve. “Weird.” He weakly nodded his head to the stump of his arm. “I thought having no heart was strange, but this…” he released a soft breath, “it doesn’t feel real.”

“It’s better than your life,” Steve remarked softly.

“Yeah. I’ve always had a thing for trying to get myself killed, huh,” Tony said, a huff of a laugh following his words.

Steve couldn’t help the crooked, closed-lipped smile cross his face. “Not this time, Shellhead.”

“No,” Tony agreed, his eyes heavy. “Not this time.”

They lapsed back into silence. Steve watched as Tony’s eyelids fluttered shut, sleep taking over him. He swallowed, blinked, and realized his eyes were wet. He reached a hand out and rested it next to Tony’s limp one, where a heartbeat monitor was clipped on his thumb. He glanced back up at Tony’s face; noted his parted lips and lax expression. He looked back at his hand. Maybe…?

“You did the right thing.” It was so weak that Steve scarcely heard it, but it was enough to make Steve’s eyes snap back to Tony’s face in a startle. His eyes were still shut, and there was still a softness to his lips. “It was hard, but you did.”

Steve’s fingers grasped the sheets of the bed. “I know.” And he hated that he did.

“Peggy would’ve wanted you to live your life here. With us. You know that,” Tony spoke. Steve couldn’t bring himself to meet his gaze – he wasn’t sure if Tony’s eyes were even open. “She told you to move on. She’d want you to move on, not be stuck in the past. You deserve a family like she did.”

Steve’s eyes burned with tears, but he refused to let them fall.

He jumped when dainty fingers weakly grasped his own, curling around the digits. Only the last three fingers, hardly a full touch, yet Steve’s shoulders shook at the contact.

“We need you,” Tony murmured, more breath than words. “I’m glad you’re here, Winghead.”

“I’m glad you’re here, too, Tony.” Steve couldn’t let himself say anymore. His voice was too shaky. He felt a tear slip down his cheek, but didn’t move to wipe it away.

“Go see if Nat’s okay, too,” were Tony’s last words before he fell asleep.

Steve smiled, blue eyes glassy.

They won.

i just have a lot of feelings
summary: Everyone made sure that on Tony's birthday he felt loved. Clint made him his special lasagna and thanked him for every special...
body: Everyone made sure that on Tony’s birthday he felt loved. Clint made him his special lasagna and thanked him for every special arrow he has made for him. Bruce gave him all of his special brands of tea and spend the time with him in the lab, smiling at him. Thor, with a big smile on his face, gave him the Asgardian Mead and patted his shoulder saying with a booming voice that he had never met a man braver than the Man of Iron. Natasha kissed him on the cheek and hugged him, whispering a quiet thank you for creating the ballet room and offered to teach him, which was met with an amused chuckle. Pepper sassed him, giving him the strawberries and a big bunny and Tony laughed his ass off when he saw it. Rhodey send him an album of all of their greatest pictures from college. Steve hugged him close and thanked for helping him for getting used to this new world and told him he was the hero everyone should look up to, which was met with Peter’s approval as the teen shyly gave him the robot of his making that was suspiciously similar to Dum-e. At the end of the day Tony never felt happier.

Natasha kissed him on the cheek and hugged him, whispering a quiet thank you for creating the ballet room and offered to teach him, which was met with an amused chuckle. Bruce gave him all of his special brands of tea and spend the time with him in the lab, smiling at him. Thor, with a big smile on his face, gave him the Asgardian Mead and patted his shoulder saying with a booming voice that he had never met a man braver than the Man of Iron. Natasha kissed him on the cheek and hugged him, whispering a quiet thank you for creating the ballet room and offered to teach him, which was met with an amused chuckle. Pepper sassed him, giving him the strawberries and a big bunny and Tony laughed his ass off when he saw it. Rhodey send him an album of all of their greatest pictures from college. Steve hugged him close and thanked for helping him for getting used to this new world and told him he was the hero everyone should look up to, which was met with Peter’s approval as the teen shyly gave him the robot of his making that was suspiciously similar to Dum-e. At the end of the day Tony never felt happier.

summary: Tony @ Peter’s graduation
body:
Tony @ Peter’s graduation

Can you just imagine Peter has to give a speech, and he has Tony help him and Peter keeps joking that at the end of his speech he’s going to tell everyone he’s Spider-Man and Tony knows he joking but if it doesn’t scare him a bit that Peter might do it. Then Peter’s doing his speech and at the end he says “and the truth is I am……..” and stops and Tony’s heart almost stops when Peter finishes with “I am really thankful” and Tony almost kills Peter after all of it but secretly is really proud of him.
